title: How to Make Papier Mâché Flowers

steps.headline: Draw a large leaf shape.
steps.description: Cut it out using and Exacto Knife or Scissors

steps.headline: On a separate piece of cardboard draw and cut individual flowers petals.
steps.description: 3-4 works best. Make them large enough to hang slightly over the edge of the leaf

steps.headline: Using a Hot Glue Gun position and stick the petals onto the leaf shape.
steps.description: The petals should all join in the middle.

steps.headline: Mix some papier mâché paste using Flour, Water, and Salt.
steps.description: Add a squirt of white glue as it will make the paste stronger

steps.headline: Rip some Paper Towel or Kitchen Towel into small squares.
steps.description: Paper Towel makes a nicer finish one the flower is done

steps.headline: Papier mâché the flower with 2 layers.
steps.description: One side at a time. This ensures even drying

steps.headline: Once dried gather some acrylic paints.
steps.description: Paint your flowers to your heart's desire. Allow the paint to dry

steps.headline: Seal your flowers using regular varnish.
steps.description: For outdoor use apply marine varnish

steps.headline: Decorate with sequins or Hot Glue a pom-pom to the centre of the flower

text: Gather some scrap cardboard. Thick cardboard works best Draw a large leaf shape. Cut it out using and Exacto Knife or Scissors On a separate piece of cardboard draw and cut individual flowers petals. 3-4 works best. Make them large enough to hang slightly over the edge of the leaf Using a Hot Glue Gun position and stick the petals onto the leaf shape. The petals should all join in the middle. Mix some papier mâché paste using Flour, Water, and Salt. Add a squirt of white glue as it will make the paste stronger Rip some Paper Towel or Kitchen Towel into small squares. Paper Towel makes a nicer finish one the flower is done Papier mâché the flower with 2 layers. One side at a time. This ensures even drying Once dried gather some acrylic paints. Paint your flowers to your heart's desire. Allow the paint to dry Seal your flowers using regular varnish. For outdoor use apply marine varnish Decorate with sequins or Hot Glue a pom-pom to the centre of the flower  Finished!
